blog.name: criticalrole-incorrectquotes
blog.title: How Would You Like To Quote This?

summary:
(Beauregard): I'm flexible. I do a lot of yoga.

(Mollymauk): you do yoga?

(Beauregard): helps keep me centred. If you ask me...
body:
(Beauregard): I’m flexible. I do a lot of yoga.

(Mollymauk): you do yoga?

(Beauregard): helps keep me centred. If you ask me about it again, I’ll hunt you down and rip your face off.

reblog.comment:
(Beauregard): I’m flexible. I do a lot of yoga.

(Mollymauk): you do yoga?

(Beauregard): helps keep me centred. If you ask me about it again, I’ll hunt you down and rip your face off.

trail.content_raw:
(Beauregard): I’m flexible. I do a lot of yoga.

(Mollymauk): you do yoga?

(Beauregard): helps keep me centred. If you ask me about it again, I’ll hunt you down and rip your face off.
trail.content:
(Beauregard): I’m flexible. I do a lot of yoga.

(Mollymauk): you do yoga?

(Beauregard): helps keep me centred. If you ask me about it again, I’ll hunt you down and rip your face off.

blog.name: kimabutch
blog.title: Revolutionary
blog.description: I'm Charlie! I'm attempting to tag "cr spoilers" until the subsequent Tuesday, but don't expect perfection. I'm into a lot of things — right now it's mostly Critical Role, but Utena still owns my heart. 22, butch lesbian, she/her. Link to asks!

summary: What do you think about vex being Percy’s major psychological hold on himself?
question: What do you think about vex being Percy’s major psychological hold on himself?
answer:
Hm, I don’t know. I don’t think I’ve watched enough of the series to say for sure, I guess — I’m only on episode 29. At the moment, it seems like Keyleth who’s the one keeping Percy most psychologically stable, though obviously in a platonic, not romantic way. I think she (and to a lesser extent, Pike) have this role for a lot of VM, actually, as one that they want to protect, both physically and mentally — she’s their princess, and definitely the most innocent of the group. So they don’t want to hurt her or let her get hurt.

I think Percy and Vex clearly have a flirtatious relationship at this point, and like all of VM, they clearly care for each other deeply. But I wouldn’t say she’s his biggest morality chain at this point, at least not from what I’ve seen.

summary: Fictober Day 3 - A Scene by the Ocean
title: Fictober Day 3 - A Scene by the Ocean
body:
Decided to try my hand at some Critical Role fanfic soooo here’s a Fjordester-implied ficlet. Enjoy!

Ko-Fi

A lonely girl perches on the rocks, sketchbook in hand. The scratch of pencil in hand and the whisper of the sear rolling onto sand are the only sounds accompanying the seagulls circling overhead.

Jester absentmindedly pulls a donut from her pack and nibbles at the icing as she shades the seafoam. As she scans the beach for any details she might have missed, beautiful seashells or bits of driftwood, a glimmer of emerald catches her eyes. Standing for a better vantage point, she shields her eyes from the sun overhead, and sees what looks like a figure stretched out on the beach, the tides lapping at their lower half.

Jester tucks away her sketchbook and hops down onto the sand, already pulling a fresh, or only slightly stale, pastry from her backpack. She stops in her tracks when she is close enough to see the washed-up man whole. Half-orc torso, but a fish’s tail. She approaches with a bit more trepidation. Spotting a small twig, she reaches down for it and gives the mer-orc a small poke.  

He mumbles something in his sleep and scrunches his face up. Jester watches with fascination as the mer-orc pulls his head up from the ground and looks around in dazed confusion. When his yellow eyes fall on her, he blinks at her in surprise.

Jester waves her hand. ‘Hi.’

‘Hi yourself.’ He winces and clutches his side. 

Jester has to crane her neck to see the small wound across his ribs.

Jester holds a donut out to him. He looks at it and then back at her questioningly.

‘For the pain.’

‘Oh, ummm…’ He reaches up and plucks it from her fingers. He spins it around in his fingers, as though examining it. Jester begins to feel the silence between them thicken.

‘Jester!’

‘What?’

‘My name…my name is Jester.’

‘Fjord.’ He shakes her hand. 

‘Eat, it’ll help,’ Jester insists as she plops down on the sand next to him.

He takes a tentative bite in, and chews for a bit longer than is necessary. ‘It’s…it’s good.

‘Right?’ Jester grins, quite pleased with herself as she pulls back out her sketchbook.

‘What are you doing?’ he asks, raising his head to peek at the pages.

‘I need to capture this moment. Not everyday you meet a mer-orc, especially a handsome one at that.’

His cheeks grow a darker shade of green at her words, not that Jester really pays any attention as she continues her work.
body_abstract:
Decided to try my hand at some Critical Role fanfic soooo here’s a Fjordester-implied ficlet. Enjoy!

Ko-Fi

A lonely girl perches on the rocks, sketchbook in hand. The scratch of pencil in hand and the whisper of the sear rolling onto sand are the only sounds accompanying the seagulls circling overhead.

blog.name: dr-archeville
blog.title: Doktor Archeville's Laboratory
blog.description:
Hi!  I am a fat 40-something white introvert in NC.  I worked in the NCSU Libraries for 13 years, then was an insurance agent working with Aflac (quack!) for about 9 months, and currently work as a substitute teacher in Roxboro & a repairer/maintainer of sewing machines out of my home.
My preferred pronouns are he/him/his; my preferred nicknames are Doc or Dok, or Science Squid (or Jon).

I am a fan of... things.  So many things.
* Comics (DC Comics, Marvel Comics)
* Tabletop RPGs (Dungeons & Dragons/D&D/DnD, Eclipse Phase, GURPS, Pathfinder, Shadowrun, World of Darkness) (My OCs, my games)
* Video Games (Elder Scrolls series, Fallout series, Minecraft)
* Podcasts (Binging with Babish, Critical Role)
* Webcomics (Order of the Stick, Oglaf, SMBC, Schlock Mercenary, xkcd)
* Geek Culture /  Geek Life /  Misc. Geekery (including memes)

Basically, if it's got cosplay, fantasy, horror (esp. body horror and zombies), science (or SCIENCE!) & sci-fi, steampunk, or superheroes (or supervillains), I'll probably love it.

I also try to keep up with actual science and technology, especially body modification and transhumanism.
I also blog about libraries and library- & librarian-related things (including books), in part because I'd worked in a library for thirteen years, and about education (especially education in NC and education in America) due to my work in academic libraries and as a substitute teacher.  And about language and linguistics, as those fascinate me.
Also about jobs and job hunting, since I've been unemployed or underemployed for an uncomfortably long time, and we could all use a little help there.
I also enjoy cooking (and food), which is a type of science.  Here are some recipes I've collected.

This being the internet, I also reblog posts with cute animals.  I'm especially fond of bats.  And squid, cuttlefish, and other cephalopods. While I'm listing animals, I may as well provide a link to my cat posts.  It is the internet, so there are a lot of them.

I'm a big fan of/believer in people being themselves, and of consenting adults being able to do whatever they want however they want with whoever they want, no matter what others think.  (I.e., body positivity, sex positivity).  I try to keep this blog SFW -- the only porn I'll be posting here are food porn and technology porn -- but I do sometimes talk about sex (esp. sex education) and burlesque (there are some great burly troupes in the Triangle & Triad area).

I struggle with mild depression and anxiety issues, so sometimes my blog may get a bit maudlin.  But I also try to give advice on dealing with those, too.
-----------------------
Things I've Liked (Note: May contain some NSFW posts)
My Tumblr Crushes
My personal blargings
About Me / It Me
Getting To Know Me
My TMI Tuesday blargings
My Feels

Conventions!
* Animazement
* ConCarolinas
* ConTemporal
* Cosplay America
* Dragon*Con / Dragon Con

My Face
My Facebook
Art-related blargings
Music-related blargings
Most Fridays nights I’m at the Retro Film shows at the the Carolina Theatre in Durham.  Come join me!

blog.name: shelbyroundthemountain
blog.title: Pod save my soul
blog.description: Shelby, She/Her, Libra, INFP. I enjoy podcasts and petting my cat Clifford. I post a lot of meta about Critical Role and other podcasts. I also have been trying to blog more about my personal experience and mental health, but I understand that's not what everyone wants on their dash so anything too serious will be tagged BUMMER ZONE. I also try my best to tag triggers but I can't make any promises.I encourage you to message to talk about ANYTHING you see here. I don't have nearly enough people to chat with.

summary: the biggest cultural difference between TAZ and Critical Role is how you use “campaign” or “arc”
title: the biggest cultural difference between TAZ and Critical Role is how you use “campaign” or “arc”
body: like if im not mistaken the whole first game in TAZ is dubbed the Balance Arc, but in CR each campaign has multiple arcs (Whitestone Arc, etc)

blog.name: thewritingangle
blog.title: The Writing Angle
blog.description: where inspiration and drabbles go to live another day

summary: I think scanlan would take the chalice, to save his mom and vax. He already tried for the eye, someone would have to fight him...
question: I think scanlan would take the chalice, to save his mom and vax. He already tried for the eye, someone would have to fight him for the chalice too.
answer:
I KNEW I FORGOT SOMEONE(S)!!!! Sorry Scanlan and Tarry 😭

I have to say that I partially disagree with you about Scanlan though. He’s already seen what his impulses and actions can do, and while he’s certainly not the wisest, he’s gotten wiser. (I’m talking about him at the end of the campaign btw). Honestly, I don’t think he would take the chalice for his mother because he is, quite literally Ioun’s champion after the whole Vecna business goes down. He knows that his mother’s story has already been recorded, and that it will be an everlasting song. And it’ll be a mournful, bittersweet one, but she will be remembered and loved by him forever.

So yes, he would be tempted with rewriting time to save his mother (as would Vex and Vax with their mother if Vax hadn’t died and wasn’t the more immediate wound for Vex). But I’m almost tempted to say that he would actually be offered to go back in time to save Vax in that final battle, not his mother. His mother’s death due to goblins was awful. But him not being able to excute his plan to save Vax, or rather, having to give up saving Vax in favor of saving the world, is going to be something that wracks his sleep for ages. (I’m sure he wakes up crying some nights, and Pike and Grog both are there to help shoulder some of the pain).

So the chalice would offer him to change the Vecna battle as a whole, and be able to save his wish spell to keep Vax, one of his closest friends, with them. A chance to save a close friend and save the world, ideally with fewer casualties. That would be a hard temptation to resist.

And honestly, going to that point in time makes it easy to diverge, so preventing a time paradox would be easy, since not a ton of time has passed since the event (assuming the chalice approaches him after the final battle, but before the M9 exist). Also, he wouldn’t have the pain of all his friends forgeting most of their adventures and found family state. I think whether or not he takes the chalice will depend heavily on how the grieving process has weighed on him in the following years.

As for Tary, he’s a rich boy alchemist/tinkerer/i forget his actual class. If anything, he’d go the gilderoy lockheart route with a book detailing his adventures to find the chalice, and then his heroic denial and destruction of the device (some versions of the book will detail his denial of the chalice, and then interviews the has with the chalice instead of destroying it, but those books are limited edition and hard to find). The truth of the books sounds dubious at best, as is the Tarry way.

blog.description: Hi! I’m TuiteyFruity (b. 1995). Call me Tuitey for short. Pronounce it like the jellybean flavor Tutti Frutti! I am known for writing the Let it Go parody "Let Them Burn". This blog is safe for work! [They/Them]. Jewish (duh). Religious but not spiritual. Homeschmuck.

summary:
Beau: Did Yasha just tell me she loved me for the first time?
Jester: Yeah, she did. 
Beau: ... and did I do finger guns back?...
body:
Beau: Did Yasha just tell me she loved me for the first time?
Jester: Yeah, she did. 
Beau: ... and did I do finger guns back? 
Jester: Yeah, you did.

dialogue.name: Beau
dialogue.label: Beau:
dialogue.phrase: Did Yasha just tell me she loved me for the first time?

dialogue.name: Beau
dialogue.label: Beau:
dialogue.phrase: ... and did I do finger guns back?

summary:
Lol remember when Vax shrunk down and was 6 inches shorter than Scanlan? 
It’s such a weird visual bc Scanlan has gnome...
body:
Lol remember when Vax shrunk down and was 6 inches shorter than Scanlan?

It’s such a weird visual bc Scanlan has gnome proportions while Vax doesn’t! he’s 2 feet tall with half elf proportions and I’ve never seen art of it.

I’m not a great artist but I’m gonna give it a shot

Here I’m figuring out the how they would look standing next to each other

I can also see why Scanlan was so off-put by it. He’s obviously been near smaller gnomes and gnome children but it’s not the same!
